text: Dégustation Manseau printemps 2017. Une robe brune avec une mousse mince et beige. Un nez dalcool, de chocolat, de fudge, bancale. Une bouche simple avec du fudge sur un fond dalcool chaud. Pas ma meilleure de la série.

Doskonała równowaga między składnikami. Beczka świetna, nie uderza alkoholowością, fajnie wkomponowane, ale nie wybitna. Cynamon - dokładnie tyle ile powinno być. Kawa w ogóle nie męcząca, zero kwaskowatości. Dopracowane do perfekcji. Znakomite piwo

(Cycle Trademark Dispute (Yellow)) Bottle at Anticarnaval tasting. Black coloured body, tall and thick dark brown head on top, good retention.
Aroma has bourbon, cinnamon, roasted malts, vanilla.
Taste has bourbon and vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, roasted malts,alcohol.
Thcik body with soft carbonation.
Very good.

22, capped. Thanks, guys! Pours an opaque mahogany with a dense and creamy dark tan head. Big sweet nose, lots of milk chocolate and some dark chocolate, with faint hits of vanilla suggesting marshmallow. Creamy thick body, a bit sticky, moderate carb. Dark earthy roasty base to the palate under tons of chocolate and hints of marshmallow. Long earthy deep finish.

Poured up at Ratebeer Best 2017 Beer Fest where it exhibits a deep dark body that supports a tall dark tan head of foam. The aroma offers up mostly chocolate followed by a thin layer of dark roasted malts, a hint of burnt malts and then more inviting milk chocolate and a thin barrel treatment like marshmallow note. The taste starts smooth and pretty silky ushering in fairly decedent notes of pure dark chocolate, dark roasted malts, smooth residual sugars, a dash of marshmallow and then even more of a chocolate sensation into the finish. Yummers.
Bouteille 650ml. Couleur noire opaque,mousse moka foncée. Arôme de cannelle, malt torréfié, boisé. Goût de café, malt torréfié, cannelle, Bourbon. Carbonatation​ faible, corps dense.

Bottle (22 oz) shared at tasting. Pitch black with a small beige head with a small beige head, good retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is intensely flavorful with coffee, cinnamon, roasted malts, caramel notes and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet but not overly so with plenty of cinnamon, coffee, roasted malts, caramel and a bit of alcohol. Medium-full body. Medium carbonation. Coffee and lingering cinnamon finish. A bit of alcohol heat. Really flavorful. Borderline artificial but enjoyable nonetheless.

Un autre gros stout bien contrôlé avec des épices qui sajustent aux malts qui sont riches. Chocolat, café, biscuits en bouche. Alcool brun qui court sur chacune de mes papilles. Le corps est adapté aux grandes soifs. Qui a déjà dit que le stout impérial nétait pas un étancheur de soif? Certainement pas moi. Muscade et cannelle. Effet piquant modéré. Une autre prestation solide. Jaime ou jadore, il faut choisir lun ou lautre ou les deux.

Bouteille. Robe noire opaque avec un petit col de mousse brunâtre. Arômes de noisettes, chocolat, vanille, caramel, cannelle, café anisé. En bouche, cannelle, chocolat noir, café noisettes, bourbon boisé. Traces de baies rouges, miel, malt torréfié. Texture huileuse et corps rond.
220z bottle part of the set, this was the best of the bunch easily surpassing all the anniversary coffee beers, better balanced with the barrel, cinnamon adds a nice touch

22 oz. bottle as part of the blind BA stout tasting at seeswos house. Pours an opaque brown with a small tan head that settles into a ring. The cinnamon is up front, with coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, charred oak, warming bourbon, earth, and subtle cocoa and vanilla sweetness. Medium-bodied, with medium carbonation and a spicy, rich, sweet mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Trademark Dispute set.

Dark brown body with a small beige collar. Cinnamon leaps out in the olfactory senses. Lovely and elegant in all facets. Cinnamon and coffee characters are melded in perfect harmony.

Bottle poured into a snifter showing pitch black with sparse latte foam. 

The nose shows bourbon forwardness with hints of cinnamon. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Flavors of coffee forwardness but with a vanilla brightness. Finish is dark chocolate.

Aroma has a great balance of coffee and bourbon. Nice smooth coffee, no chili aroma like what often comes with coffee. Smooth and rounded. Mild cinnamon. Flavor has a cinnamon punch up front that fades to mild roast and chocolate. Mild coffee in the aftertaste.
Jak Abraxas :) Czekoladka, taka słodziutka, z cynamonem i kawą, do tego wanilia i Bourbon. Znakomite piwo.

35,5cl Bottle @ Zombier, Malaga, Spain.
Black colour with a thick brown head.
Aroma is chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roast, nuts, bourbon, cinnamon, oak.
Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, spices.
Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation.
A bit boozy.

Panel #9 Rami Rami is drinking a Trademark Dispute Yellow Label Cinnamon Coffee by Cycle Brewing Company at Chmielarnia Marszałkowska

Cynemaon ewidentny, kawa na drugim miejscu, czeko na trzecim, calosc slodkawa, gladka, mila, bardzo smaczna, choc fanem cynamonu nie jestem
Toasted coconut, sweet, vaporous aroma - very nice. Inky, viscous. Spicy, chocolate, a little boozy, raisiny, roast. Full bodied. Warming. Thanks to Tim and Rachel down at Proof.

Draft @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate woody bourbon coffee aroma. Roasted malty woody bourbon chocolate coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty woody coffee chocolate finish.

Bottle @ Benzais Crazy Carnaval 2017, 5-10 cl sample, thanks all for sharing! Dark color, medium frothy head. Aroma of lots of bounty candy bar, bit spicy cinnamon, lots of chocolatey sweetness. Quite sweet in taste, coconut, cinnamon, roadty bitterness. Wonderful.

(Bottle) Pours an opaque black body with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, pumpkin, caramel, cinnamon, nutmeg, and coffee. Flavor of coffee, chocolate, cinnamon, roasted malt, oak, caramel, vanilla, and bourbon.

van fles @Benzais Anti-carnaval Tasting; schenkt zwart met bruine kraag, aroma van kokos, chocolade, geroosterde en gebrande mouten, bounty achtig. Smaken zijn heerlijk, kokos, enorm veel chocolade, kaneel, koffie, geroosterde en gebrande mouten, moutig, redelijk zoet, bourbon, iets te hoge co2, vanille, volle body, enorme lange zoet afdronk. fantastisch

Pours coal black with a bubbly, dark brown, fluffy head.

Smells of cinnamon infused milk chocolate, together with glazed caramel and a note of earthen, roasted coffee. The coffee inherits a wild berry quality, adding a light tartness to the rich maltiness. Its bourbon barrel blends perfectly into the adjuncts, enhancing the spiciness of the aromas, together with scorched oak, entangled into layers of soothing milk chocolate and the rustic coffee.

Has a lower carbonation with lots of whipped cream, creating a smooth, fuller mouthfeel. Turns a tad warm during the finish, due to the barrel, creating a warming glow after the swallow down the throat.

Tastes of caramel enhanced cinnamon spices, fudge, licorice and bitter chocolate. The coffee is less pronounced than the spiciness, lending an earthen sweetness to the flavors, which gets flawlessly picked up by the barrel. More chocolate, whipped cream and a warming dryness with a hint of booze create a nice complexity, leaden by rustic malts and sweet milk chocolate. 

Rich and fulfilling on the tongue, well balanced and highly enjoyable with a nice peak, created by the barrel enhanced adjuncts. The base beer is strong though, exhibiting a convincing taste foundation, which gets more complex, due to the adjuncts.

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus for the Trademark Dispute Set Share. Aroma is cinnamon, coffee, chocolate, barrel, booze, sweet, fucking great. Appearance its dark dark brown, light brown head, poured thinnish. Taste is cinnamon, chocolate, booze, barrel, coffee, roasted malt, nice. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, wonderful cinnamon coffee booze aftertaste. Overall, very enjoyable, Im happy to have finally tried it.

Poured from a 22 oz bottle. 
Ariana so very cinnamon forward with medium light coffee notes. Moderate chocolate notes with light roast notes. 
Pours black with a moderately large, thick mocha head that slowly recedes to a small film that lingers for quite some time. Light lacing and moderate legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet with lots of chocolate. Light roast notes. Moderately strong cinnamon notes with some moderate coffee. Medium bitterness. Light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a decent beer but the cinnamon is too strong. Coffee is nice, but a bit light.

Bottle @ Anti-carnaval Tasting. Opaque pitch black color, medium to full sized brown colored head. Aroma is malts, cinnamon, chocolate, soft roast. Tastes about the same: malts, soft roast, maybe slight coffee, light chocolate, light alcohol bitter finish. Very nice, but a bit too heavy on the cinnamon for me.
Bottle @ anti-carnaval tasting. Black with a medium sized brown head. Smells roasty, Bounty candybar, coconut, chocolate. Tastes coconut, Bounty, roasty, chocolate, sweet. Full body, soft carbo.

[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. As Cycle Pallet 1. Black with a big brown head. Great aroma with chocolate, coffee, nuts, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon. Sweet flavor with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, a bit of coffee, spiciness, and some bitterness in the finish. Full-bodied. Awesome.

Bottle. Pours black with a dark mocha head. Looks fantastic once poured. Aromas of vanilla, coffee, roasted malts, bourbon. Taste is sweet with coffee, roasted malts, some light alcohol after it has warmed. (The cinnamon had faded by now. It is light and in the background which is nice.) Full bodied and chewy. Carbonation is soft; lightly drying finish. The flavors linger... My first Cycle beer, and Im impressed, for sure.

RB Best. It pours a dark brown color with a fluffy dark brown head. The aroma has fudge brownies with some wood and bourbon. The flavor has lots of spicy wood notes with cinnamon, anise, dark fruit and alcohol heat. Very woody and rich.

Draft pour at RateBeer Best 2017. Listed as Pallet 1. Black with tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, sweet coconut. Tastes of coconut, dark chocolate, light booze, cocoa. Full body with a dry finish. Fantastic.
Black with a khaki head. Coffee, alcohol, cinnamon, alcohol and coffee. Chewy palate, coffee, fudge, chocolate and sweet.
(22oz bomber) espresso brown, fine tan bubbles. Nose of vanilla, bourbon, cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate. Taste of vanilla, rich chocolates, alcohol, cinnamon, touch of peppers, rich bakers chocolate.

@RBB
Black with mocha head. Wonderfully smooth with a restained barrel presence. That, or its just expertly balanced with the coffee and spice, all done very well.
Sample at RateBeer Best. As Pallet 1. Pours dark brown with a tan, chocolatey head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, chocolate and coffee. Fantastic.
At Ratebeer Best. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head and a marvelous chocolate aroma. There is a rich chocolate and coffee flavor with a little cinnamon and a warm alcohol trail.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: pours oily black, opaque with foamy brown head aroma-flavors: roasted grain, dark malts, cinnamon, molasses, vanillin, bourbon. All ingrediends are perfectly incorporated, perfectly blended. Body is full almost thick,  texture is so f*** creamy smooth. Carbonation low to moderate. Superb.
Taster at Ratebeer best. Pours a dark brown color with a lot of head. Lovely cinnamon flavor. Lovely balance of cinnamon, hops and malt.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Cinnamon and vanilla, bourbon, sweet aromas. Flavors are sweet and dark, roasted, vanilla and cinnamon.
Bottle shared at Aarons. Medium body. Like others except for dominant cinnamon and some coffee. Nice.
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Bottle thanks to Craig. Pours. French toast crunch, toasted coconut. Dry mouthfeel. Overpowering Cinnamon flavor. Medium mouthfeel. Solid oak flavor.

650 ml bottle at home thanks to Glen! Black color with nice brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, light coffee, spicy, lots of cinnamon, vanilla, coconut, light wood and alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma, a little more coffee, lots of coconut in the aftertaste. Full oily to creamy silky body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2017 Bomber shared by AdamChandler, 7/23/16.Dark mahogany, very opaque, with no tan head.Big hazelnut and chocolate aromas, with sweet cream, big buttercream and rich fudge.Intense amounts of sweet chocolate, fudge and vanilla with a big milk chocolate finish. Chocolate, sweet, fudge and dry vanilla-almond.  Look Ma, Im ticking!

Adam with the bottle share. Aromas is mild bourbon, weak coffee, lmild notes of cinnamon. Also notes of coconut. 
This stout has mild molasses, bourbon and light levels of cinnamon. The mouthfeel is what you look for in the style. Full, thick and creamy. The coconut level is pretty nice, reminiscent of a liquid Mounds candy bar. SNAp! This is pimping!!!

Bomber shared by AdamChandler. Thanks, Adam! Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon. Smells nice. Flavor is nice too. Dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, cinnamon, coconut. Mmmm.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler dark black pour with a nice tan head and nice lacing. Aromas of caramel vanilla coffee and cinnamon. Taste is nice creamy chocolate coffee and lingering cinnamon spice.

Bomber. Acquired in a trade. 

A - Oily thick black with a little red edges. 

S - The nose is like Tiramisu. Cinnamon and coffee overload with gingerbread ,oats, coffee, cocoa, vanilla. It like a christmas cake / cookie mixture. 

T - This is amazing stuff. Cinnamon for DAYZZZZ. Vanilla on lock down. its got this Christmas fudge flavor with loads of vanilla and wow.z

M - Thick like syrup, dense and loaded with flavor and the finish is a remembrance of all of the cinnamon lives that were lost making this beer with lingering cinnamon cake.

O - Great stuff man. everything is well balanced. Its sweet but as soon as you finish the sip, that sweetness is gone and leaving a bitterness and you will want more.
pours pitch black. Aroma is roasted malts cinnamon coffee chocolatehas some barrel character and sweetness. Flavor as aroma, not overwhelmingly bitter more smoth. A bit boozy on a nice way.
Purs pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma; Vsnilla, cinnamon,dark chocolate, bortom and coconut. Taste; Vsnilla, bortom, cinnamon, coconut and dark chocolate.

May 28, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of milsem, thanks! 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is cinnamon, toasted coconuts, roasted coffee, burnt wood, vanilla notes, toffee, hints of dark chocolate. 
Taste is sweet, spicy and light bitter. Finish is spicy, medium bitter and slight salty with cinnamon, hints of sweet toffee, cinnamon, some woody notes, light dry woody canela and oak notes. Medium to full bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Good, a bit cinnamon heavy.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 A: Pitch black with a brown one finger head N: Cinnamon, vanilla, bourbon, coconut, coffee T: Cinnamon, coconut, milk chocolate, coffee O: Nice, but very heavy on the cinnamon.

Bottle at Wailin Whales in Linus apartment 160528. Opaque black beer with a nice brownish head. Chocolate and cinnamon aroma, coffee, caramel, coconuts, vanilla, ice coffee, clove, raisins, woody, some bourbon. Cinnamon flavor, coffee, raisins, caramel, biscuits, warming alcohol, ice coffee, woody, some cream. Quite nice, but rather sweet.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2016 Bottle courtesy of milsem. Pours viscous black with a small mocha head that leaves some spotty trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malty, spicy and tiny vegetal with roasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, green bell peppers, cinnamon, roasted coconut, moist soil and hints of bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and spicy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, viscous, tiny astringent, tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasty chocolate malts, cinnamon and coconut. Tasty but a bit too heavy on the cinnamon in my opinion. Cycle makes incredible beers and deserve a spot in the top 50 but this isnät their top offering.
Black pour. Nose is a cinnamon bomb. Taste is cinnamon, a little bit of coffee, booze, more cinnamon, chocolate. Medium sticky mouthfeel.
Another impressive offering from Cycle, showing tons of coffee above cinnamon, coconut, vanilla bean and light bourbon notes. Long, creamy finish, with the heat covered well.

Bottle. Pours blacker than black. Creamy, perfect sized dark head. Smell is intense, roasty malts, bourbon , I get cinnamon, but more balanced than what youre used to in this type of beer. Taste is cinnamon-forward, just , but barely, not too much cinnamon. Coffee is rather hidden. I do get a crazy amount of roasted malts, and a part of the bourbon sweetness. Some wood. Complex, still balanced ( even though, like I said before, the cinnamon is pushing the border ) the taste developes over the pallet ( whats in a name ) and turns better for my taste, towards the aftertaste. 
Enjoyable mouthfeel and carbo. All and all, another great stout from these guys. Expectations might have been to high - given the feelings I got from the previous ones I tried, combined with the crazy scores - but this is not my favorite from the series by far. Still a world-class beer though !
Its got a lot of coffee and cinnamon and its a really good Cycle beer. Alright peace.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare ft. Lukasmh and Daawi. Pours pitch black with a small mocha head. Aromas of cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla, green coffee, roast, burned wood, dark chocolate, coconut. Holy fuck. This smells too good. Taste follows. Lots of cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla, huge dark chocolate richness, roasty coffee, fudge, coconut. God damn, Cycle!

Bottle at home with my dad. Pitch black pour with a small creamy tan head and good lacing. Big cinnamon, raisins, coffee, some toffee, dates, dark chocolate, and roasted malt in the aroma. Rich toffee, raisins, cinnamon, cocoa nibs, some light bourbon notes, anise, some vanilla, and toasted malt notes with a sweet finish. Thick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Really tasty stuff and still had a lot of spice notes - wish I could have had it fresh.

[ bottle ][ 6oz ][ @tasting ][ $ ? ][ snifter ][ 10.24.15 ]black with thin cream head, large bubbles cling. Balanced nose reminds of Mexican cake, soft cinnamon and sweet cocoa, faint coffee bitterness, sweeter than the Tequila Cake but smoother than the Bourbon. Inky front palate of light cinnamon and dark chocolate, thick, viscous body, pleasant meld to toasty mid-palate, softly chalky end shows light cinammon and chocolate, faint off green amidst chalky profile.  [ 10.23-24 Tasting Ranking ]  01. Ganstaller Brau XL1 02. Hill Farmstead Genealogy of Morals 03. Hill Farmstead Daybreak Orange Liqueur 04. Westbrook Mexican Cake tequila 05. Hill Farmstead Works of Love (De Molen 13) 06. Voodoo Pappy Van Winkle Black Magick   07. Trillium PM Dawn (Ketiara) 08. Dieu du Ciel Isseki Nicho 09. Cycle Pallet 1 10. Cycle pallet 2 11. Westbrook Mexican Cake Bourbon  12. Hitachino Nest Expresso BA Ichiros Malt  13. Westbrook Mexican Cake double  14. Brew Gentlemen I15. Cycle pallet 3  16. Cycle Pallet 4  17. Night shift mordred  18. Bottle Logic Fundamental Observation  19. Cigar City Double Barrel Hunahpu  20. Jackie Os BA Naja  21. Prairie pirate bomb

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare featuring Lukas and Aaron. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of dat gewd gewd cinnamon. Cinnamon rolls, chocolate, vanilla, sweet barrel notes, fresh ground coffee and some weak coconut. Errh yuurh! The taste has some coconut, cinnamon, chocolate, vanilla, sweet bourbon and smooooothness. Body is a little thin but this smells and tastes amazing!
Awesome beer! Deep brown pour with a brown head. Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, charred oak, cinnamon, sweet but not cloying. Great stuff

Bottle. Pours pitch black, thick tan head, lasting. Aroma is cinnamon, honey, sweet, toasty, chocolate, candy, spice, chili, cinnamon bun, remonce, spice. Taste is a cinnamon bomb! Remonce, not to sweet, spice, bit thin, taste is awesome! Chocolate, toasty finish, fruity. Sweet and sticky. Lasting taste! Very much cinnamon and quite peppery.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshare featuring Lukas and Aaron. Pitch black with a dark mocha head. Nose has tons of spice, cinnamon and coffee. Taste has cinnamon, vanilla, light peppery, smooth, buttery and some light honey notes. A bit thin...

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares Feat Lukas&Aaron! Got this in a trade. Pours a pitch black with a big, tan head. Yeeees! Aroma has tons of cinnamon (!), coffee, buttery, salty remonce, vanilla, bourbon, lots of coconut, green bell peppery coffee, caramel, medium dryness. Taste is medium sweet, huge spice, cinnamon, medium roasted, fresh coffee, bourbon and a pretty dry finish. Chocolate and caramel. Average carbonation, and unfortunately the body is a little light for my taste. But man this is good beer!

Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Pours a blackish brown with a slight tan head. Aromas of marshmallows, cinnamon, coffee. Taste is slightly sweet and fudgey. The body is medium. Not a thick impy stout but I loved it.
Poured a very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma was of big cinnamon and coffee, light fudge too. Flavor similar, but a bit watery and thin. Still overall a really tasty beer.
Bottle thanks to Dan. Poured black with thinning beige head. Aroma smooth bourbon vanilla coffee some cinnamon spice. Med bod light carb. Taste pretty super bitter dark roast coffee.

Pour is black with a coffee colored head. Nose is light coffee, less than 4, faint spice, from the cinn, lightly roasted malt and faint chocolate cake malt. Flavor isnt bad, a touch sweet, light coffee, hints of vanilla, more pulled together than some of the cakes, some rich chocolate maltiness. Full bodied, soft feel, soft carb.

Shared bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate, cinnamon, bourbon, and vanilla. Taste is cinnamon, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, and coffee. Delicious is an understatement.
bottle, yea this is awesome. very much like hunahpu, strong cinnamon with an even stronger base rich thick stout. All poured over extremely thick brownie batter. YUM

Bottle shared at the Moeder Lambic cellar session 2015. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of plastic, cinnamon, nutmeg, light coffee, dark chocolate. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Decent but over hyped, not one of the best cycle stouts.

From notes. Enjoyed on September 19 at Travis house. 22 oz bottle from Tommy and Chris I believe. The pour is a dark, thick, viscous black with a thin dark khaki cap of head and no lacing. The aroma is a cinnamon and bourbon bomb up front. There is a nice coffee that goes with a nice roasted malt, dark chocolate, and then the barrel kind of takes over on the back end. There is a nice charred oak and vanilla before giving back to the cinnamon and coffee. The flavor is Just as good. The cinnamon isnt as potent as the nose would lead on. Its still there, but the balance is a lot better in the flavors. Lots of coffee and a solid roasted chocolate malt. There is a lighter barrel presence but the oak and vanilla make solid offerings. There is a nice bourbon heat on the back end. The mouth feel is viscous and chewy. There is a soft carbonation to help this thing stick around. The aftertaste is lingeringly cinnamon and coffee with a light bourbon on the finish. Very good beer.
Bottle thanks Chris and tommy. Black color with tan head. Aroma is roasted chocolate and barrel. Taste is where the cinnamon shines! Loads of it and coconut and chocolate cake.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2015 bottle recieved in a trade. shared with a friend. had some very high expectations for this one. seeing those incredible high ratings. poured a black colour with a small creamy mocha head on top. a strong cinnamon aroma jumps the nose while pouring, covered by dark roasted chocolate, toffee, and sticky campfire bourbon in the end. burned caramel, and dark toasted malts. cinnamon is everywhere. and maybe the cinnamon was a bit to dominant. it doesnt get anoying. some chocolate puding, charred oak, and a faint coconut hint. slight spice pepper note, all flavors are perfectly balance. the only point that doesnt make this a world class beer is the mouthfeel. it was a bit thin. and it should me more sticky. but again.. this one is very very good!
Bottle shared by whaleslayer (Dan). Nose is cinnamon and vegetal pepper. Moderate vanilla. I swear there are peppers. Lots of vanilla lots of choco. Good to grate but there is a pepper thing.

Share thanks to beechboi2 and his bff. Aroma is full of cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate. Dark blackish brown pour, tan head. Lots of cinnamon, sweet choco malt, vanilla, oak. Not much bourbon character.  Oxidation like character in nose and flavor finish.

Bottle share thanks to Nate. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla. Taste is lots of cinnamon. Bourbon takes a back seat. The mouthfeel is thick, cinnamon lingers on the tongue for awhile. This is really good.
Another fantastic offering from Cycle! Excellent body and mouth feel on this one. Preferred Pallet 1 over Pallet 2 personally but to each is own.

Bottle from Gabriel, cheers! Poured into a snifter. Color is inky black with brown hues. Medium brown head emerges and fades to a ring. Aromas are of an initial sweet sticky bourbon, followed by sweet black strap molasses, treacle, light coffee, light vanilla and a hefty dose of cinnamon. Taste has lots of cinnamon. Seems to overwhelm the other flavors. Not as much coffee as I expected either. Maybe it was my expectations that came with this beer but it fell short of being world class for me in the mid-palate and finish. I was hoping for a bit more body in the mouthfeel....a bit more creaminess...and a bit more balance among the profile. Given the ingredients, I dont get a lot of depth but quick flashes and undertones of coffee/earth/cocoa. Finishes sweet with doses of cinnamon and molasses, wet oak and bourbon. While this certainly was a tasty beer, it was not quite on par with the other Top 50 Imperial Stouts that Ive had the pleasure of trying.

22 oz. bottle, pours black with a small brown head. Aroma brings out complex whiskey barrels, cocoa and caramel. Flavour is complex, with whiskey barrels, cocoa and cinnamon. Really cohesive and complex. Phenomenally balanced. Excellent.

Small head, to an extremely thick beer. Almost like motor oil.
Smell is heavly of cineamon and a tad of bourbon. 
Taste is sweet, but the cineamon takes over fast and the bourbon plays out well adding a vanilla taste with the oak and ends in a bitter dark chocolate feel. 
Feel is excelent, very smooth even it the flavours is so heavy
Overall a well executed beer, extreme balance considering all the things hapening in the beer. Would drink any day. 

Only minus is because of the head and that the cineamon was so heavy in the aroma. Which is pretty much good things.

Bottle. Pours a very dark brown with medium creamy tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong cocoa, bourbon, cinnamon. Thick mouth, chewy, nice roast coffee, cinnamon, dark chocolate, boozy finish, very nice.
Bottle - Great rich spice, graham and chocolate. Deep jet brown with a brown head. Nice spice, cinnamon, roast and a long finish. Nice.

Scored this bottle in a trade for some Heady & HF. It completely blew my mind. The mouthfeel is unreal, and it reminded me of how thin some of the stouts are that I have been drinking lately. I wish I could drink this stuff every day. Safe to say I will be sending out more beers from New England to secure as much of this stuff as possible.

Here we go. Bottle thanks to Matt - huge props for this one. Pours opaque black, small brown head, goo lacing. Aroma is really nice, cocoa, lots of cinnamon and coffee, vanilla and a hint of chili pepper. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, lots of cinnamon, cocoa notes, coffee -- mocha. Lightish body for the style. This is a solid beer. Its really a shame that its being pimped to the point that nobody will actually pay attention to how god it is or isnt. Shame on yall.

Aroma: Coffee, chocolate, spice
Appearance: motor oil black, thin lace around the glass
Taste: medium sweetness, not bitter, coffee, cinnamon, warming booze
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation
Overall: excellent execution of the BA stout style. Does not get better than this.
Fantastic beer all around. such a great combination of coffee and cinnamon.
Such a great beer. Cinnamon and coffee just blended so well. The stouts coming out of Cycle right now are some of the best available. Fantastic brew.

Dark pour, little head. Aroma is coffee forward, chocolate, vanilla. Taste is similar with killer cinnamon and bourbon notes and a perfect mouthfeel. 

Ridiculously great balance. Amazing beer, one of the best Ive had.
slight spice heat and cinnamon bomb at the front, coffee and sweet spice rounds out the back end. delicious!

One of the best stouts Ive had in a long time. Lucky enough to score a bottle from a local traveling to Colorado. Coffee Cinnamon Explosion. Really solid barrel profile, Thick and a touch roasty aided by the coffee. A very nice balanced stout. Cycle Has their stout game on point!
Cracked this a couple weeks ago when a friend was visiting. Holy cinnamon and coffee! It is such a wonderfully balanced beer.
The cinnamon and coffee are a perfect combination to go with the bourbon notes from the barrel. Excellent!

Cycle kills these stouts every damn time. Opened by a friend at a recent bottle share. Coffee and Cinnamon bomb but balanced real well by the roast stout profile and bourbon/oak from barrel. Keep em coming.
Bottle in snifter on my back patio relaxing on an adirondack chair around 5-6pm with a gentle breeze caressing my neck... And the beer was amazing too.
This is my favorite cycle beer to date thus far. Pure cinnamon everywhere you look. Coffee is there but subtle. Did I mention there was cinnamon?

Another exquisitely balanced BA stout from cycle. Big cinnamon without dominating. This beer is right up there with Fremont Abominable - Bourbon Barrel Coffee Cinnamon as one of the best BA adjunct stouts Ive had, especially when looking for one not as sweet as many on the market.

one of the best adjunct stouts Ive had. balanced, yet every flavor is there in force. usually beers with cinnamon are overpowering for me in that aspect. this was just well crafted almost beyond belief
To me, this is the definition of a perfect beer. The coffee, cinnamon, and barrel are so perfectly integrated that it left me wanting nothing else.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2015 22oz bottle poured into a snifter. Great chocolate head. Lots of cinnamon and whiskey. Rich whiskey flavor, subtle coffee adds bitterness chocolate and roasty notes great balance. Bitter finish. A bit boozy, but in all the right ways. Great beer.
Bottle. Pours black brown head. Nose/taste of cinnamon, vanilla, cinnamon toast crunch, roast chocolate and cookie malt - medium/full bodied.
Bomber. Intense cinnamon and coconut. Not getting much coffee. Surprised at how much coconut Im getting. Touch of rum. Really smooth. Body is thin for the style but the flavor is outstanding.

Imperial Stout #200! I dont know what to say. One of the best beers Ive ever had. Cinnamon is huge, some coffee spice and roast, chocolate, and huge coconut notes from the barrels. Liquor is very smooth and doesnt come off super hot. Sure it could be thicker, but its rich as hell already. Near perfect.

Bottle. Dark brown pour with a light brown head. Cinnamon and booze bouquet. Loads of cinnamon, whiskey, coffee, and dark roasted malts. A bit thinner in the the body than previous batches IMHO, with a very good mouthfeel.

650 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Medium khaki head with a wispy surface. Tons of cinnamon and whiskey. Kinda nutty. Rich whiskey flavor, too. Cinnamon all over. Cinnamon persists throughout. I get some coffee in the back. Bitter finish. Medium heavy. Boozy. Delicious cinnamon flavor throughout. Its really the highlight.
Bottle - Pours dark black. Nose is lots of cinnamon, coffee, oak, vanilla, bourbon. Taste is coffee, chocolate, cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla. Its tasty!!!
